lines:
Turan

mp. Med. College 
Tientein, Chine.

August 31, 1911. 
my dear hr. Steams,

As I have been home almost a monts, I deem 
it my duty to write and inform you of my condition in 
regards to my return to the States. My father has decided 
I to keep me in China this year and to prepare to enter 
I the Ching stua College in Peking where d'eau persue

a further course of Chinese studies which I have been 
recher deficien. I shall of course love no time on my 
ater English subjects, and I hope that this will enable 
me to return to the states next summer when I hope 
to have tu pleasure of seeing you and hws. Stearns 
again. As to an ammont I have overdrawn from you 
please let my Fashir know, and he will be very glad 
to ufund you te same. Permit me to express 
you again my gratitude for In Kindness which you 
have bestoured on me, and I shall look back with 
mingle feelings upon the days I have spent under 
your care, and the circle of acquaintances I have made 
in Andover whom I wich never to be forgotten, and 
wf to whom I hope to be always remembered. Please 
do not reserve the room 29 in Bays Hall for me. In 
concluding I hope that happiness and health shall 
abide with you always. dam

" Yours obediente,

5. 5. Kwan
raw: Turan mp. Med. College Tientein, Chine. August 31, 1911. my dear hr. Steams, As I have been home almost a monts, I deem it my duty to write and inform you of my condition in regards to my return to the States. My father has decided I to keep me in China this year and to prepare to enter I the Ching stua College in Peking where d'eau persue a further course of Chinese studies which I have been recher deficien. I shall of course love no time on my ater English subjects, and I hope that this will enable me to return to the states next summer when I hope to have tu pleasure of seeing you and hws. Stearns again. As to an ammont I have overdrawn from you please let my Fashir know, and he will be very glad to ufund you te same. Permit me to express you again my gratitude for In Kindness which you have bestoured on me, and I shall look back with mingle feelings upon the days I have spent under your care, and the circle of acquaintances I have made in Andover whom I wich never to be forgotten, and wf to whom I hope to be always remembered. Please do not reserve the room 29 in Bays Hall for me. In concluding I hope that happiness and health shall abide with you always. dam " Yours obediente, 5. 5. Kwan

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter with an update about the year ahead. He will be staying in China to enter the Ching Hua College in Peking. He will pursue a course in Chinese studies, in which he is deficient. He hopes to return to the U.S. in the summer. He states that his father will settle the balance on his account. He expresses his deep thanks and asks that room 29 in Day's Hall not be held for him.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
